lines.content: This is a task management robot that use to manage different types of tasks of user.
This user guide is to guide the user how to use this robot on command line input
This robot can identify in 3 different tasks, todo, event and deadline
Also it can record and display the tasks user input, modify the status, search task by name and retrieve tasks from the disk.
Create a new todo task: enter the command "todo taskName"
Create a new deadline task: enter the command "deadline taskName /by dd/MM/yyyy hhmm"
Create a new event task: enter the command "event taskName /from dd/MM/yyyy hhmm /to dd/MM/yyyy hhmm"
Delete a task: enter the command "delete indexOfTheTask"
Mark a task as done: enter the command "mark indexOfTheTask"
Unmark a task: enter the command "unmark indexOfTheTask"
Show what's in the list: enter the command "list"
Search for tasks by name: enter the command "find taskName"
Hilary chatbot is a **task management** chatbot that use to manage different types of tasks via a **Command Line Interface**.
This robot can identify in 3 different tasks, **todo**, **event** and **deadline**
It can also **record** and **display** the tasks user input, **modify the status**, **search task by name** and **retrieve tasks** from the disk.
Shows how to use the program in the terminal
Adds a todo task to the list
- `todo CS2113 iP` add a todo task call CS2113 iP into the task list
Adds a deadline task with deadline time to the list
- `deadline CS2113 iP /by 05/10/2023 2359` add a deadline task  CS2113 iP with the deadline time is 5th Oct 2023 at 11:59pm
Adds a event task to the list
Format: `event taskName /from dd/MM/yyyy hhmm /to dd/MM/yyyy hhmm`
- `event CS2113 iP /from 10/08/2023 0000 /to 05/10/2023 2359` add a event task CS2113 iP with the starting time of 10th Aug 2023 12:00am to 5th Oct 2023 11:59pm
Delete a task by it's index
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- `delete 1` delete the 1st task in the task list
Mark a task as done by it's index
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- `mark 1`  mark the 1st task in the task list as done
mark a task as not done by it's index
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- `unmark 1` mark the 1st task in the task list as not done
Find tasks in the taskList with the keyword
- The search is case insensitive e.g CS2113 will match cs2113
- The order of the keywords does matter. e.g. cs2113 ip will not match ip cs2113
- Any task contain the keyword will be match e.g. 2113 will match with CS2113
- `find CS2113` return the task name include CS2113 with case insensitive
Shows a list of all tasks in the task list
Task list data are saved in the hard disk automatically after any command that changes the data. There is no need to save manually.
**Q**: How do I transfer my data to another Computer?
**A**: Send the Hilary.txt inside the JAR file location to another computer's JAR file location for the duke
* The `CommandExecutor` class is responsible for executing various commands based on user input in the Hilary robot.
* It delegates the execution of specific commands to their respective command classes and handles error cases.
* This class serves as the central controller for processing user commands and interacting with the task list.
* Constructs an `CommandExecutor` object with the specified command, user input, parser, and task list.
* @param command The command to be executed.
* @param userInput The user input associated with the command.
* @param parser The parser for processing user input.
* @param tasks The task list where tasks are managed.
* Executes the appropriate action based on the provided command.
public void executeCommand(String command, String userInput, Parser parser) {

* The `Duke` class is the main class for the command-line task management robot Hilary.
* It handles user input process, task management, and tasks storage, allow user to
* add, mark, unmark, delete, and search for tasks. It also supports
* different types of tasks such as Todo, Deadline, and Event.
* Constructs a `Duke` object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path for storing and retrieving task data.
* The main entry point for the Hilary robot.
System.out.println("\tOOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
System.out.println("Something went wrong while saving the file.");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Task is an abstract class representing a generic task in the Hilary robot.
* It includes fields and methods for retrieving the task's description and status.
* Task objects serve as the base class for specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Subclasses extend Task to provide additional functionality and formatting.
* - description: The description of the task.
* - isDone: A boolean variable indicating whether the task is marked as done.
* Constructs a `Task` object with the specified description and initializes it as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Gets the status of the task (whether it is done or not).
* @return `true` if the task is marked as done, `false` otherwise.
* Gets an icon representing the status of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " (a space) if it's not done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Unmarks the task, marking it as not done.
* Gets the description of the task.
* Converts the task to a string representation.
* @return A string representing the task, including its status icon and description.
* Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to get the event time associated with the task.
* @return A string representing the event time (applicable to event-type tasks) or an empty string.
* The `Ui` class provides methods for user interface and displaying messages to the user.
* Displays a greeting message when the Hilary robot is launched.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays a help message providing instructions on how to use the Hilary robot.
System.out.println("- Add a Todo task: 'todo task'");
System.out.println("- Add a Deadline task: 'deadline task /by dd/MM/yyyy HHmm'");
System.out.println("- Add an Event task: 'event task /from dd/MM/yyyy HHmm /to dd/MM/yyyy HHmm'");
System.out.println("- Mark a task as done: 'mark taskIndex'");
System.out.println("- Unmark a task as done: 'unmark taskIndex'");
System.out.println("- Search for tasks by name: 'find taskName'");

* and adding the task to the task list. It ensures that the start time of the event is before the end time.

* It processes user input, identifies the task to be deleted, and performs the deletion.
* This class also handles error cases such as invalid input and out-of-bounds task indices.

* The `FindTasks` class is responsible for searching for tasks in the Hilary robot's task list based on user input.
* It processes user input, searches for tasks that match the keyword, and displays the matching tasks to the user.
* This class handles the searching functionality and provides user feedback on the search results.
* Constructs a `FindTasks` object with the given user input keyword and task list.
* @param userInput The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* @param tasks The task list in which to search for matching tasks.

* If no matches are found, a message informing user is displayed.

* The `MarkTask` class is responsible for marking tasks as done in the Hilary robot's task list.
* It processes user input, identifies the task to be marked as done, and updates its status.
* This class also handles error cases such as invalid input and out-of-bounds task indices.

* The `PrintList` class is responsible for displaying the task list in the Hilary robot.
* It retrieves the task list and prints each task to the user, along with the total number of tasks.
* This class provides a convenient way for the user to view the contents of their task list.
* Constructs a `PrintList` object with the given task list.
* @param tasks The task list to be printed.
* It also displays the total number of tasks in the list.
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list");

* It processes user input, identifies the task to be unmarked by index, and updates its status.

* TaskList represents a list of tasks for the Duke Robot
* It provides methods for adding different types of tasks (Todo, Event, Deadline)
* into the ArrayList, instead of allowing the Duke program to modify the content in the list,
* retrieve tasks by index, getting the size of the task list, printing the list,
* marking tasks as done, unmarking tasks, and deleting tasks. It also supports
* searching for tasks containing specific keywords.
* TaskList is used to manage and manipulate tasks within the Hilary robot.

* It supports saving tasks of different types (Todo, Deadline, Event) along with their

* SaveToFile is used to persist tasks to a file when the user added new tasks to the Hilary robot.
